title: Authorizes the town of Guilderland, county of Albany, to elect a third town justice
summary: Authorizes the town of Guilderland, county of Albany, to elect a third town justice.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

           S. 1164                                                   A. 899

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                             S E N A T E - A S S E M B L Y

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       IN SENATE -- Introduced by Sen. BRESLIN -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Govern-
         ment

       IN  ASSEMBLY -- Introduced by M. of A. McENENY -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Local Governments

       AN ACT to amend the town law, in relation to providing for the  election
         of  a  third  town justice in the town of Guilderland in the county of
         Albany

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 1 of section 20 of the town law is amended by
    2  adding a new paragraph (m) to read as follows:
    3    (M) NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF ANY GENERAL,  SPECIAL  OR  LOCAL
    4  LAW  TO  THE CONTRARY, THE TOWN BOARD OF THE TOWN OF GUILDERLAND, COUNTY
    5  OF ALBANY MAY ADOPT A RESOLUTION, SUBJECT TO A PERMISSIVE REFERENDUM  AS
    6  PROVIDED  BY ARTICLE SEVEN OF THIS CHAPTER, AT LEAST SIXTY DAYS PRIOR TO
    7  ANY REGULAR OR SPECIAL ELECTION DETERMINING THAT SUCH  TOWN  SHALL  HAVE
    8  THREE  TOWN  JUSTICES. IF THE TOWN BOARD OF SUCH TOWN SHALL HAVE ADOPTED
    9  SUCH A RESOLUTION AND NO PETITION SHALL HAVE BEEN FILED WITHIN THE  TIME
   10  SPECIFIED  FOR  A REFERENDUM THEREON, OR IF A MAJORITY OF THE VOTES CAST
   11  ON ANY SUCH PROPOSITION SUBMITTED TO THE VOTE OF THE ELECTORS BE IN  THE
   12  AFFIRMATIVE,  THE  ELECTORS  OF  SUCH TOWN SHALL ELECT AT THE SUCCEEDING
   13  GENERAL ELECTION A TOWN JUSTICE WHO SHALL TAKE OFFICE FOR A TERM OF FOUR
   14  YEARS BEGINNING ON THE FIRST DAY OF JANUARY NEXT SUCCEEDING SUCH BIENNI-
   15  AL TOWN ELECTION.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02075-01-1
